Patient 1: John is a 62-year-old male with a history of hyperlipidemia and hypertension. He has been on atorvastatin for the past two years but recently started experiencing muscle aches. He is also taking lisinopril for blood pressure management. John is retired and enjoys gardening, which he finds difficult due to his current symptoms.
Patient 2: Maria is a 55-year-old female with type 2 diabetes and high cholesterol. She has been managing her diabetes with metformin and insulin. Recently, she started experiencing muscle pain, which she suspects is related to her simvastatin medication. Maria works as a school teacher and is concerned about her ability to maintain her active lifestyle.
Patient 3: David, a 70-year-old male, has a history of coronary artery disease and has been on rosuvastatin for cholesterol management. He reports new onset muscle aches that have been affecting his daily walks. David is also on aspirin and metoprolol. He lives alone and is keen on maintaining his independence.
Patient 4: Linda is a 48-year-old female with familial hypercholesterolemia. She has been on various statins over the years and is currently taking pravastatin. She recently developed muscle aches and is worried about her ability to continue her job as a nurse. Linda is also on a low-dose aspirin regimen.
Patient 5: Carlos, a 60-year-old male, has been managing his high cholesterol with lifestyle changes and medication. He started experiencing muscle pain after being prescribed lovastatin. Carlos is a retired engineer who enjoys hiking and is concerned about how his symptoms might affect his hobbies.
